docs.lead_paragraph: Representative Michael G. Grimm, a Republican, is facing federal fraud charges after a lengthy corruption inquiry, people with knowledge of the case said.

headline.main: Indictment Expected for Grimm, Staten Island Congressman
headline.print_headline: Congressman Said to Face U.S. Charges of Fraud

docs.abstract: Rep Michael G Grimm, Republican of Staten Island, is expected to be indicted on federal fraud charges after a lengthy corruption investigation; charges against Grimm are expected to focus largely on his conduct in connection with a health food restaurant.
docs.snippet: Representative Michael G. Grimm, a Republican, is facing federal fraud charges after a lengthy corruption inquiry, people with knowledge of the case said.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mobile applications and devices let people take pictures of moles or record a heartbeat and then communicate accordingly with their doctor.

headline.main: Health Care Apps Offer Patients an Active Role
headline.print_headline: Health Care Apps Offer Patients an Active Role

docs.abstract: Ann Carrns Your Money Adviser column on health care apps that offer more active role for patients; mobile applications and devices allow people to communicate with their doctor about health concerns, often without need for appointments and office visits.
docs.snippet: Mobile applications and devices let people take pictures of moles or record a heartbeat and then communicate accordingly with their doctor.

docs.lead_paragraph: We ran through a lot of ideas — Crux, anyone? — before arriving at our name.

headline.main: The Upshot, and 45 That Didn’t Make the Cut

docs.snippet: We ran through a lot of ideas — Crux, anyone? — before arriving at our name.

docs.lead_paragraph: In the West, it’s a manageable chronic condition. In places like India, it’s a different story.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by endocrinologist Kasia Lipska warns that diabetes has become full-blown epidemic in India and many other emerging economies; notes that in places like India, diabetes is not manageable chronic condition like it is in the developed world; calls for conceptual shift in the way disease is treated in poor countries.
docs.snippet: In the West, it’s a manageable chronic condition. In places like India, it’s a different story.

docs.lead_paragraph: Oregon, whose health insurance network has been dogged by technical glitches that have prevented even a single subscriber from enrolling online, will move its state health exchange to the federal system, officials said on Friday.

headline.main: Oregon's Broken Healthcare Exchange to Shift to Federal Network
headline.print_headline: Oregon's Broken Healthcare Exchange to Shift to Federal Network

docs.snippet: Oregon, whose health insurance network has been dogged by technical glitches that have prevented even a single subscriber from enrolling online, will move its state health exchange to the federal system, officials said on Friday.

docs.lead_paragraph: Philadelphia's two largest newspapers will be sold at an ascending-bid auction open only to insiders, a Delaware judge ruled Friday.

headline.main: Judge: Philly Newspapers to Be Sold to Insiders
headline.print_headline: Judge: Philly Newspapers to Be Sold to Insiders

docs.snippet: Philadelphia's two largest newspapers will be sold at an ascending-bid auction open only to insiders, a Delaware judge ruled Friday.

headline.main: How to Get Better Insurance Data, Without Encouraging Conspiracy Theories

docs.abstract: The lack of a detailed monthly tally of the uninsured is a big hole in the nation’s statistics.
docs.snippet: The lack of a detailed monthly tally of the uninsured is a big hole in the nation’s statistics.

docs.lead_paragraph: Top officials for Oregon's troubled health insurance network, dogged by technical glitches that have kept a single subscriber from enrolling online, recommended on Thursday dumping the state website in favor of a federally run healthcare exchange.

headline.main: Oregon's Broken Healthcare Exchange May Move to Federal Network
headline.print_headline: Oregon's Broken Healthcare Exchange May Move to Federal Network

docs.snippet: Top officials for Oregon's troubled health insurance network, dogged by technical glitches that have kept a single subscriber from enrolling online, recommended on Thursday dumping the state website in favor of a federally run healthcare exchange.

docs.lead_paragraph: After months of trying to get its problem-plagued online health exchange to work, Oregon on Friday officially gave up on the state portal and decided to switch to the federal website — the first state in the nation to do so.

headline.main: State Leaving Online Health Exchange for US Site
headline.print_headline: State Leaving Online Health Exchange for US Site

docs.snippet: After months of trying to get its problem-plagued online health exchange to work, Oregon on Friday officially gave up on the state portal and decided to switch to the federal website — the first state in the nation to do so.

docs.lead_paragraph: More Democratic candidates are making support of the health care law a campaign issue, particularly the negative consequences if Republicans succeed in repealing it.

headline.main: Democratic Candidates Grow More Vocal in Supporting Health Law
headline.print_headline: Democratic Candidates Grow More Vocal in Supporting Health Law

docs.abstract: More Democratic candidates in midterm elections are making support of the health care law a campaign issue, particularly the negative consequences if Republicans succeed in repealing it; party is said to shift 'from defense to offense' in ads.
docs.snippet: More Democratic candidates are making support of the health care law a campaign issue, particularly the negative consequences if Republicans succeed in repealing it.
